results.title: Gilbert & Sullivan's Iolanthe: or the Peer and the Peri
results.brief_description: Banished for twenty-five years for marrying a mortal, beautiful fairy, Iolanthe, returns from her watery prison still only seventeen years old. But her youth and beauty cause trouble when her half-mortal son, Strephon, cannot convince his fiancee, Phyllis, that the girl with whom he is discovered is really his mother. Phyllis decides to marry a Lord instead, and the Fairy Queen has to meddle in politics to set things right - even reuniting Iolanthe with Strephon’s father, the Lord Chancellor. Performers include: Derek Hammond-Stroud, Richard Van Allan, Kate Flowers, Alexander Oliver, Anne Collins, Sandra Dugdale. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. John McCarthy (Chorus Master), Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Staged by David Poutney. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.

results.title: Gil and Liz Hopkins
results.brief_description: Gil and Liz Hopkins have lived in Laharum, in western Victoria, for over 30 years. They raised three children there, built their own home, which is nearly completely self-sufficient, with solar panels and reclaimed water. Their hope is to leave the land in better shape than they found it and they’re taking their knowledge to the community to help others do the same.

results.title: Gigi
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Gigi (Leslie Caron) is a young tomboy being transformed by her Aunts in the hope of her becoming a beautiful and successful courtesan - just like themselves in their hey day - to become the mistress of Gaston (Louis Jourdan). Inevitably, Gaston falls in love with Gigi, captivated by her innocence and child like manner. The protagonist of the film is provided by Maurice Chevalier as Gaston’s Uncle, who was once in love with Gigi’s aunt. Considered the last great film in Minelli’s career, the story is based on a story by Colette. Cast also includes Hermione Gingold, Eva Gabor and Isabel Jeans. (Awards: 13 Academy awards, including Best Picture, 1958)

results.title: Gifts from the earth
results.creator_credit: Theodore Thomas, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Planet earth”.
There are only 150 sites world wide for the minerals essential to man and in the past decade we have been made aware that the earth is a closed system and its resources are finite. This program looks at the challenge of finding new sources of these minerals and the highly sophisticated technologies which are employed to do so, and also at how the resources are created.

results.title: Gifted kids
results.creator_credit: Keet Neville, Jennifer Torrance, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Exceptional or gifted children represent a great potential for society, yet the majority of these children go unrecognized because public educational systems are not geared to challenge their academic, artistic and personal growth. This documentary, through interviews with teachers, parents and gifted students in Coquitlam, British Columbia, looks at one of the few school districts in North America that has continually expanding enrichment programs throughout its primary and secondary grades. The film examines how these programs stimulate the students’ particular talents, and discusses some of the problems that gifted children face in the absence of such resources.

results.title: Gifted kids
results.creator_credit: Kay Donovan and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Grace and Billy Tao are Australian parents of three extremely gifted sons. Terry (14) is a Maths whiz who began university studies at age 9. His younger brother, Trevor (12), was born autistic but as a young child revealed an exceptional talent as a musician. The youngest, Nigel (10) is an all rounder but his IQ is still far higher than the national average. The Tao boys are shown at home and school and discuss how being recognised as a “gifted child” affects their lives. Includes interviews with their parents and teachers.

results.title: Gift of life
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the collections of blood from donors and its use in hospitals. Stresses the need for blood for transfusions every hour as part of medical service today; the procedure of voluntary donation, facilities provided and the careful labelling, testing and typing carried out by the Red Cross staff; the method of refrigerated storage and transport; use of separated components; an operation in process with the assistance of blood transfusions.
